content: Very good column! It ties in nicely with other material written about the ‘financialization’ of corporate America. That is, how those in the executive suites and the corporate board rooms seem only interested in short-term financial goals. All the attention seems to be paid to the shareholders, at the expense of all the other stakeholders the company ought to be more interested in: their employees, customers, suppliers, community, and creditors. In that order, in my opinion, with shareholders at the bottom of the list.
